016package com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.hsluv;
017
018import com.badlogic.gdx.Gdx;
019import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.*;
020import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.Batch;
021import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.TextureRegion;
022import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.glutils.ShaderProgram;
023import com.badlogic.gdx.math.Affine2;
024import com.badlogic.gdx.math.MathUtils;
025import com.badlogic.gdx.math.Matrix4;
026import com.badlogic.gdx.utils.NumberUtils;
027
028import java.nio.Buffer;
029
030/**
031 * A substitute for {@link com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.SpriteBatch} that adds an additional attribute to store an
032 * extra color's worth of channels, used to modify the H, S, and L channels of a color by multiplication (called the
033 * "tweak") while the primary color affects the color additively (just called the color, often drawn from
034 * {@code Palette} or generated with {@link ColorTools}). This ColorfulBatch uses the HSLuv color space where
035 * SpriteBatch normally uses RGBA, which means that in the batch color, red maps to additive H (hue), green maps to
036 * additive S (saturation), blue maps to additive L (lightness), and alpha continues to be multiplicative alpha.
037 * Additive values cause no change when they are 0.5, but cause a sharp increase at 1.0 and a sharp decrease at
038 * 0.0. In the tweak, red maps to multiplicative H, green maps to multiplicative S, blue maps to multiplicative L, and
039 * alpha maps to "exponential-like" contrast. Like with the additive values, 0.5 causes no change for multiplicative
040 * values, but you can think of the existing color as being temporarily shifted down by 0.5 for each of the HSL
041 * channels, so each HSL channel's range is -0.5 to 0.5 before being multiplied by the corresponding tweak value (times
042 * 2.0, which means multiplicative tweak values for S that are less than 0.5 make colors closer to grayscale and
043 * values greater than 0.5 make colors more vibrant) and then shifted back to its prior range. Contrast is a special
044 * value; 0.5 still means "no change," but lower values will make L changes less distinct between similar colors, while
045 * higher values will "sharpen" the changes in L.
046 * <br>
047 * Created by Tommy Ettinger on 1/21/2021.
048 * The shader here is a port of <a href="https://github.com/EsotericSoftware/hsl/blob/main/src/com/esotericsoftware/hsluv/Hsl.java">this MIT-licensed code by Nathan Sweet</a>.
049 */
050public class ColorfulBatch implements Batch {
051    public static final int SPRITE_SIZE = 24;
052    public static final String TWEAK_ATTRIBUTE = "a_tweak";
053
054    private final Mesh mesh;
055
056    private final float[] vertices;
057    private int idx = 0;
058    private Texture lastTexture = null;
059    private float invTexWidth = 0, invTexHeight = 0;
060
061    private boolean drawing = false;
062
063    private final Matrix4 transformMatrix = new Matrix4();
064    private final Matrix4 projectionMatrix = new Matrix4();
065    private final Matrix4 combinedMatrix = new Matrix4();
066
067    private boolean blendingDisabled = false;
068    private int blendSrcFunc = GL20.GL_SRC_ALPHA;
069    private int blendDstFunc = GL20.GL_ONE_MINUS_SRC_ALPHA;
070    private int blendSrcFuncAlpha = GL20.GL_SRC_ALPHA;
071    private int blendDstFuncAlpha = GL20.GL_ONE_MINUS_SRC_ALPHA;
072
073    private final ShaderProgram shader;
074    private ShaderProgram customShader = null;
075    private boolean ownsShader;
076
077    protected float color = ColorTools.hsluv(0f, 0f, 128f/255f, 1f);
078    private final Color tempColor = new Color(0f, 0f, 128f/255f, 1f); // HSL from Palette.GRAY
079
080    /**
081     * A constant packed float that can be assigned to this ColorfulBatch's tweak with {@link #setTweak(float)} to make
082     * all of the tweak adjustments virtually imperceptible. When this is set as the tweak, it won't change the
083     * L multiplier or contrast, and it won't change the A multiplier or the B multiplier.
084     */
085    public static final float TWEAK_RESET = ColorTools.hsluv(0.5f, 0.5f, 0.5f, 0.5f);
086    protected float tweak = TWEAK_RESET;
087
088    /** Number of render calls since the last {@link #begin()}. **/
089    public int renderCalls = 0;
090
091    /** Number of rendering calls, ever. Will not be reset unless set manually. **/
092    public int totalRenderCalls = 0;
093
094    /** The maximum number of sprites rendered in one batch so far. **/
095    public int maxSpritesInBatch = 0;
096
097    /** Constructs a new ColorfulBatch with a size of 1000, one buffer, and the default shader.
098     * @see #ColorfulBatch(int, ShaderProgram) */
099    public ColorfulBatch() {
100        this(1000, null);
101    }
102
103    /** Constructs a ColorfulBatch with one buffer and the default shader.
104     * @see #ColorfulBatch(int, ShaderProgram)  */
105    public ColorfulBatch(int size) {
106        this(size, null);
107    }
108
109    /** Constructs a new ColorfulBatch. Sets the projection matrix to an orthographic projection with y-axis point upwards, x-axis
110     * point to the right and the origin being in the bottom left corner of the screen. The projection will be pixel perfect with
111     * respect to the current screen resolution.
112     * <p>
113     * The defaultShader specifies the shader to use. Note that the names for uniforms for this default shader are different than
114     * the ones expect for shaders set with {@link #setShader(ShaderProgram)}. See {@link #createDefaultShader()}.
115     * @param size The max number of sprites in a single batch. Max of 16383.
116     * @param defaultShader The default shader to use. This is not owned by the ColorfulBatch and must be disposed separately. */
117    public ColorfulBatch(int size, ShaderProgram defaultShader) {
118        // 65535 is max vertex index, so 65535 / 4 vertices per sprite = 16383 sprites max.
119        if (size > 16383) throw new IllegalArgumentException("Can't have more than 16383 sprites per batch: " + size);
120
121        Mesh.VertexDataType vertexDataType = (Gdx.gl30 != null) ? Mesh.VertexDataType.VertexBufferObjectWithVAO : Mesh.VertexDataType.VertexArray;
122
123        mesh = new Mesh(vertexDataType, false, size * 4, size * 6,
124                new VertexAttribute(VertexAttributes.Usage.Position, 2, ShaderProgram.POSITION_ATTRIBUTE),
125                new VertexAttribute(VertexAttributes.Usage.ColorPacked, 4, ShaderProgram.COLOR_ATTRIBUTE),
126                new VertexAttribute(VertexAttributes.Usage.TextureCoordinates, 2, ShaderProgram.TEXCOORD_ATTRIBUTE + "0"),
127                new VertexAttribute(VertexAttributes.Usage.ColorPacked, 4, TWEAK_ATTRIBUTE));
128
129        projectionMatrix.setToOrtho2D(0, 0, Gdx.graphics.getWidth(), Gdx.graphics.getHeight());
130
131        vertices = new float[size * SPRITE_SIZE];
132
133        int len = size * 6;
134        short[] indices = new short[len];
135        short j = 0;
136        for (int i = 0; i < len; i += 6, j += 4) {
137            indices[i] = j;
138            indices[i + 1] = (short)(j + 1);
139            indices[i + 2] = (short)(j + 2);
140            indices[i + 3] = (short)(j + 2);
141            indices[i + 4] = (short)(j + 3);
142            indices[i + 5] = j;
143        }
144        mesh.setIndices(indices);
145
146        if (defaultShader == null) {
147            shader = createDefaultShader();
148            ownsShader = true;
149        } else
150            shader = defaultShader;
151    }
152
153    /**
154     * Makes a new instance of the default ShaderProgram used for this ColorfulBatch, without any {@code #version}
155     * specified in the shader source. This expects an extra attribute (relative to a normal SpriteBatch) that is used
156     * for the tweak. You may want to set the code to prepend before you call this, as with:
157     * {@code ShaderProgram.prependVertexCode = "#version 110\n";
158     * ShaderProgram.prependFragmentCode = "#version 110\n";}
159     * The actual version can be different, and may need to be different for compatibility with some hardware.
160     * @return a new instance of the default shader used by ColorfulBatch for GL2 when no shader is specified
161     */
162    public static ShaderProgram createDefaultShader () {
163        String vertexShader = "attribute vec4 " + ShaderProgram.POSITION_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
164                + "attribute vec4 " + ShaderProgram.COLOR_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
165                + "attribute vec2 " + ShaderProgram.TEXCOORD_ATTRIBUTE + "0;\n"
166                + "attribute vec4 " + TWEAK_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
167                + "uniform mat4 u_projTrans;\n"
168                + "varying vec4 v_color;\n"
169                + "varying vec4 v_tweak;\n"
170                + "varying vec2 v_texCoords;\n"
171                + "varying float v_lightFix;\n" +
172                "const vec3 epsilon = vec3(0.0088564516790356308);\n" +
173                "const float kappa = 9.032962962;\n" +
174                "const mat3 m =" +
175                "         mat3(+3.240969941904521, -1.537383177570093, -0.498610760293000,\n" +
176                "              -0.969243636280870, +1.875967501507720, +0.041555057407175,\n" +
177                "              +0.055630079696993, -0.203976958888970, +1.056971514242878);\n" +
178                "float intersectLength (float sn, float cs, float line1, float line2) {\n" +
179                "    return line2 / (sn - line1 * cs);\n" +
180                "}\n" +
181                "float chromaLimit(float hue, float lightness) {\n" +
182                "        float sn = sin(hue);\n" +
183                "        float cs = cos(hue);\n" +
184                "        float sub1 = (lightness + 0.16) / 1.16;\n" +
185                "        sub1 *= sub1 * sub1;\n" +
186                "        float sub2 = sub1 > epsilon.x ? sub1 : lightness / kappa;\n" +
187                "        float mn = 1.0e20;\n" +
188                "        vec3 ms = m[0] * sub2;\n" +
189                "        float msy, top1, top2, bottom, length;\n" +
190                "        msy = ms.y;\n" +
191                "        top1 = 2845.17 * ms.x - 948.39 * ms.z;\n" +
192                "        top2 = (8384.22 * ms.z + 7698.60 * msy + 7317.18 * ms.x) * lightness;\n" +
193                "        bottom = (6322.60 * ms.z - 1264.52 * msy);\n" +
194                "        length = intersectLength(sn, cs, top1 / bottom, top2 / bottom);\n" +
195                "        if (length >= 0.) mn = min(mn, length);\n" +
196                "        msy -= 1.0;\n" +
197                "        top1 = 2845.17 * ms.x - 948.39 * ms.z;\n" +
198                "        top2 = (8384.22 * ms.z + 7698.60 * msy + 7317.18 * ms.x) * lightness;\n" +
199                "        bottom = (6322.60 * ms.z - 1264.52 * msy);\n" +
200                "        length = intersectLength(sn, cs, top1 / bottom, top2 / bottom);\n" +
201                "        if (length >= 0.) mn = min(mn, length);\n" +
202                "        ms = m[1] * sub2;\n" +
203                "        msy = ms.y;\n" +
204                "        top1 = 2845.17 * ms.x - 948.39 * ms.z;\n" +
205                "        top2 = (8384.22 * ms.z + 7698.60 * msy + 7317.18 * ms.x) * lightness;\n" +
206                "        bottom = (6322.60 * ms.z - 1264.52 * msy);\n" +
207                "        length = intersectLength(sn, cs, top1 / bottom, top2 / bottom);\n" +
208                "        if (length >= 0.) mn = min(mn, length);\n" +
209                "        msy -= 1.0;\n" +
210                "        top1 = 2845.17 * ms.x - 948.39 * ms.z;\n" +
211                "        top2 = (8384.22 * ms.z + 7698.60 * msy + 7317.18 * ms.x) * lightness;\n" +
212                "        bottom = (6322.60 * ms.z - 1264.52 * msy);\n" +
213                "        length = intersectLength(sn, cs, top1 / bottom, top2 / bottom);\n" +
214                "        if (length >= 0.) mn = min(mn, length);\n" +
215                "        ms = m[2] * sub2;\n" +
216                "        msy = ms.y;\n" +
217                "        top1 = 2845.17 * ms.x - 948.39 * ms.z;\n" +
218                "        top2 = (8384.22 * ms.z + 7698.60 * msy + 7317.18 * ms.x) * lightness;\n" +
219                "        bottom = (6322.60 * ms.z - 1264.52 * msy);\n" +
220                "        length = intersectLength(sn, cs, top1 / bottom, top2 / bottom);\n" +
221                "        if (length >= 0.) mn = min(mn, length);\n" +
222                "        msy -= 1.0;\n" +
223                "        top1 = 2845.17 * ms.x - 948.39 * ms.z;\n" +
224                "        top2 = (8384.22 * ms.z + 7698.60 * msy + 7317.18 * ms.x) * lightness;\n" +
225                "        bottom = (6322.60 * ms.z - 1264.52 * msy);\n" +
226                "        length = intersectLength(sn, cs, top1 / bottom, top2 / bottom);\n" +
227                "        if (length >= 0.) mn = min(mn, length);\n" +
228                "        return mn;\n" +
229                "}\n" +
230                "vec3 hsl2luv(vec3 c)\n" +
231                "{\n" +
232                "    float L = c.z;\n" +
233                "    float C = chromaLimit(c.x, L) * c.y;\n" +
234                "    float U = cos(c.x) * C;\n" +
235                "    float V = sin(c.x) * C;\n" +
236                "    return vec3(L, U, V);\n" +
237                "}\n"
238                + "void main()\n"
239                + "{\n"
240                + "   v_tweak = " + TWEAK_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
241                + "   v_tweak.w = pow(v_tweak.w * (255.0/254.0) + 0.5, 1.709);\n"
242                + "   v_color = " + ShaderProgram.COLOR_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
243                + "   v_color.w = v_color.w * (255.0/254.0);\n"
244                + "   v_color.x *= 6.2831 * 2.0 * v_tweak.x;\n"
245                + "   v_color.rgb = hsl2luv(v_color.rgb);\n"
246                + "   v_lightFix = 1.0 + pow(v_tweak.w, 1.41421356);\n"
247                + "   v_texCoords = " + ShaderProgram.TEXCOORD_ATTRIBUTE + "0;\n"
248                + "   gl_Position =  u_projTrans * " + ShaderProgram.POSITION_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
249                + "}\n";
250        String fragmentShader =
251                "#ifdef GL_ES\n" +
252                        "#define LOWP lowp\n" +
253                        "precision mediump float;\n" +
254                        "#else\n" +
255                        "#define LOWP \n" +
256                        "#endif\n" +
257                        "varying vec2 v_texCoords;\n" +
258                        "varying vec4 v_color;\n" +
259                        "varying vec4 v_tweak;\n" +
260                        "varying float v_lightFix;\n" +
261                        "uniform sampler2D u_texture;\n" +
262                        "const vec3 forward = vec3(1.0 / 3.0);\n" +
263                        "const vec3 sRGBFrom = vec3(2.4);\n" +
264                        "const vec3 sRGBThresholdFrom = vec3(0.04045);\n" +
265                        "const vec3 sRGBTo = vec3(1.0 / 2.4);\n" +
266                        "const vec3 sRGBThresholdTo = vec3(0.0031308);\n" +
267                        "const vec3 epsilon = vec3(0.0088564516790356308);\n" +
268                        "const float kappa = 9.032962962;\n" +
269                        "const vec2 refUV = vec2(0.19783000664283681, 0.468319994938791);\n" +
270                        "const mat3 m =" +
271                        "         mat3(+3.240969941904521, -1.537383177570093, -0.498610760293000,\n" +
272                        "              -0.969243636280870, +1.875967501507720, +0.041555057407175,\n" +
273                        "              +0.055630079696993, -0.203976958888970, +1.056971514242878);\n" +
274                        "const mat3 mInv =\n" +
275                        "         mat3(0.41239079926595948 , 0.35758433938387796, 0.180480788401834290,\n" +
276                        "              0.21263900587151036 , 0.71516867876775593, 0.072192315360733715,\n" +
277                        "              0.019330818715591851, 0.11919477979462599, 0.950532152249660580);\n" +
278                        "vec3 linear(vec3 t){ return mix(pow((t + 0.055) * (1.0 / 1.055), sRGBFrom), t * (1.0/12.92), step(t, sRGBThresholdFrom)); }\n" +
279                        "vec3 sRGB(vec3 t){ return mix(1.055 * pow(t, sRGBTo) - 0.055, 12.92*t, step(t, sRGBThresholdTo)); }\n" +
280                        "float xyzF(float t){ return mix(pow(t,1./3.), 7.787037 * t + 0.139731, step(t, epsilon.x)); }\n" +
281                        "vec3 xyzF(vec3 t){ return mix(pow(t, forward), 7.787037 * t + 0.139731, step(t, epsilon)); }\n" +
282                        "float xyzR(float t){ return mix(t*t*t , 0.1284185 * (t - 0.139731), step(t, 0.20689655)); }\n" +
283                        "float intersectLength (float sn, float cs, float line1, float line2) {\n" +
284                        "    return line2 / (sn - line1 * cs);\n" +
285                        "}\n" +
286                        "float chromaLimit(float hue, float lightness) {\n" +
287                        "        float sn = sin(hue);\n" +
288                        "        float cs = cos(hue);\n" +
289                        "        float sub1 = (lightness + 0.16) / 1.16;\n" +
290                        "        sub1 *= sub1 * sub1;\n" +
291                        "        float sub2 = sub1 > epsilon.x ? sub1 : lightness / kappa;\n" +
292                        "        float mn = 1.0e20;\n" +
293                        "        vec3 ms = m[0] * sub2;\n" +
294                        "        float msy, top1, top2, bottom, length;\n" +
295                        "        msy = ms.y;\n" +
296                        "        top1 = 2845.17 * ms.x - 948.39 * ms.z;\n" +
297                        "        top2 = (8384.22 * ms.z + 7698.60 * msy + 7317.18 * ms.x) * lightness;\n" +
298                        "        bottom = (6322.60 * ms.z - 1264.52 * msy);\n" +
299                        "        length = intersectLength(sn, cs, top1 / bottom, top2 / bottom);\n" +
300                        "        if (length >= 0.) mn = min(mn, length);\n" +
301                        "        msy -= 1.0;\n" +
302                        "        top1 = 2845.17 * ms.x - 948.39 * ms.z;\n" +
303                        "        top2 = (8384.22 * ms.z + 7698.60 * msy + 7317.18 * ms.x) * lightness;\n" +
304                        "        bottom = (6322.60 * ms.z - 1264.52 * msy);\n" +
305                        "        length = intersectLength(sn, cs, top1 / bottom, top2 / bottom);\n" +
306                        "        if (length >= 0.) mn = min(mn, length);\n" +
307                        "        ms = m[1] * sub2;\n" +
308                        "        msy = ms.y;\n" +
309                        "        top1 = 2845.17 * ms.x - 948.39 * ms.z;\n" +
310                        "        top2 = (8384.22 * ms.z + 7698.60 * msy + 7317.18 * ms.x) * lightness;\n" +
311                        "        bottom = (6322.60 * ms.z - 1264.52 * msy);\n" +
312                        "        length = intersectLength(sn, cs, top1 / bottom, top2 / bottom);\n" +
313                        "        if (length >= 0.) mn = min(mn, length);\n" +
314                        "        msy -= 1.0;\n" +
315                        "        top1 = 2845.17 * ms.x - 948.39 * ms.z;\n" +
316                        "        top2 = (8384.22 * ms.z + 7698.60 * msy + 7317.18 * ms.x) * lightness;\n" +
317                        "        bottom = (6322.60 * ms.z - 1264.52 * msy);\n" +
318                        "        length = intersectLength(sn, cs, top1 / bottom, top2 / bottom);\n" +
319                        "        if (length >= 0.) mn = min(mn, length);\n" +
320                        "        ms = m[2] * sub2;\n" +
321                        "        msy = ms.y;\n" +
322                        "        top1 = 2845.17 * ms.x - 948.39 * ms.z;\n" +
323                        "        top2 = (8384.22 * ms.z + 7698.60 * msy + 7317.18 * ms.x) * lightness;\n" +
324                        "        bottom = (6322.60 * ms.z - 1264.52 * msy);\n" +
325                        "        length = intersectLength(sn, cs, top1 / bottom, top2 / bottom);\n" +
326                        "        if (length >= 0.) mn = min(mn, length);\n" +
327                        "        msy -= 1.0;\n" +
328                        "        top1 = 2845.17 * ms.x - 948.39 * ms.z;\n" +
329                        "        top2 = (8384.22 * ms.z + 7698.60 * msy + 7317.18 * ms.x) * lightness;\n" +
330                        "        bottom = (6322.60 * ms.z - 1264.52 * msy);\n" +
331                        "        length = intersectLength(sn, cs, top1 / bottom, top2 / bottom);\n" +
332                        "        if (length >= 0.) mn = min(mn, length);\n" +
333                        "        return mn;\n" +
334                        "}\n" +
335                        "vec3 rgb2luv(vec3 c)\n" +
336                        "{\n" +
337                        "    c *= mInv;" +
338                        "    float L = max(0.,1.16*pow(c.y, 1.0 / 3.0) - 0.16);\n" +
339                        "    vec2 uv;\n" +
340                        "    if(L < 0.0001) uv = vec2(0.0);\n" +
341                        "    else uv = 13. * L * (vec2(4., 9.) * c.xy / (c.x + 15. * c.y + 3. * c.z) - refUV);\n" +
342                        "    return vec3(L, uv);\n" +
343                        "}\n" +
344                        "float forwardLight(float L) {\n" +
345                        "        const float shape = 0.8528, turning = 0.1;\n" +
346                        "        float d = turning - L;\n" +
347                        "        return mix(\n" +
348                        "          ((1. - turning) * (L - 1.)) / (1. - (L + shape * d)) + 1.,\n" +
349                        "          (turning * L) / (1.0e-20 + (L + shape * d)),\n" +
350                        "          step(0.0, d));\n" +
351                        "}\n" +
352                        "float reverseLight(float L) {\n" +
353                        "        const float shape = 1.1726, turning = 0.1;\n" +
354                        "        float d = turning - L;\n" +
355                        "        return mix(\n" +
356                        "          ((1. - turning) * (L - 1.)) / (1. - (L + shape * d)) + 1.,\n" +
357                        "          (turning * L) / (1.0e-20 + (L + shape * d)),\n" +
358                        "          step(0.0, d));\n" +
359                        "}\n" +
360                        "vec3 luv2rgb(vec3 c)\n" +
361                        "{\n" +
362                        "    float L = reverseLight(c.x);\n" +
363                        "    float U = c.y;\n" +
364                        "    float V = c.z;\n" +
365                        "    float lim = chromaLimit(atan(V, U), L);\n" +
366                        "    float len = length(vec2(U,V));\n" +
367                        "    if(len > lim) {\n" +
368                        "      lim /= len;\n" +
369                        "      U *= lim;\n" +
370                        "      V *= lim;\n" +
371                        "    }\n" +
372                        "    if (L <= 0.0001) {\n" +
373                        "        return vec3(0.0);\n" +
374                        "    } else if(L >= 0.9999) {\n" +
375                        "        return vec3(1.0);\n" +
376                        "    } else {\n" +
377                        "      if (L <= 0.08) {\n" +
378                        "        c.y = L / kappa;\n" +
379                        "      } else {\n" +
380                        "        c.y = (L + 0.16) / 1.16;\n" +
381                        "        c.y *= c.y * c.y;\n" +
382                        "      }\n" +
383                        "    }\n" +
384                        "    float iL = 1. / (13.0 * L);\n" +
385                        "    float varU = U * iL + refUV.x;\n" +
386                        "    float varV = V * iL + refUV.y;\n" +
387                        "    c.x = 2.25 * varU * c.y / varV;\n" +
388                        "    c.z = (3. / varV - 5.) * c.y - (c.x / 3.);\n" +
389                        "    vec3 rgb = c * m;\n" +
390                        "    return rgb;\n" +
391                        "}\n" +
392                        "void main()\n" +
393                        "{\n" +
394                        "  vec4 tgt = texture2D( u_texture, v_texCoords );\n" +
395                        "  vec3 luv = rgb2luv(linear(tgt.rgb));\n" +
396                        "  luv.x = forwardLight(clamp(pow(luv.x, v_tweak.w) * v_lightFix * v_tweak.z + v_color.x - 0.5372549, 0.0, 1.0));\n" +
397                        "  luv.yz = (luv.yz * v_tweak.y * 2.0) + (v_color.yz);\n" +
398                        "  gl_FragColor = vec4(sRGB(clamp(luv2rgb(luv), 0.0, 1.0)), v_color.a * tgt.a);\n" +
399                        "}";
400        ShaderProgram shader = new ShaderProgram(vertexShader, fragmentShader);
401        if (!shader.isCompiled()) throw new IllegalArgumentException("Error compiling shader: " + shader.getLog());
402        return shader;
403    }

541                        "const vec3 forward = vec3(1.0 / 3.0);\n" +
542                        "const vec3 sRGBFrom = vec3(2.4);\n" +
543                        "const vec3 sRGBThresholdFrom = vec3(0.04045);\n" +
544                        "const vec3 sRGBTo = vec3(1.0 / 2.4);\n" +
545                        "const vec3 sRGBThresholdTo = vec3(0.0031308);\n" +

551                        "              -0.969243636280870, +1.875967501507720, +0.041555057407175,\n" +

672                        "        float d = turning - L;\n" +
673                        "        return mix(\n" +
674                        "          ((1. - turning) * (L - 1.)) / (1. - (L + shape * d)) + 1.,\n" +
675                        "          (turning * L) / (1.0e-20 + (L + shape * d)),\n" +
676                        "          step(0.0, d));\n" +
677                        "}\n" +
678                        "float reverseLight(float L) {\n" +
679                        "        const float shape = 1.1726, turning = 0.1;\n" +
680                        "        float d = turning - L;\n" +
681                        "        return mix(\n" +
682                        "          ((1. - turning) * (L - 1.)) / (1. - (L + shape * d)) + 1.,\n" +
683                        "          (turning * L) / (1.0e-20 + (L + shape * d)),\n" +
684                        "          step(0.0, d));\n" +
685                        "}\n" +
686
687                        "vec3 luv2rgb(vec3 c)\n" +
688                        "{\n" +
689                        "    float L = reverseLight(c.x);\n" +
690                        "    float U = c.y;\n" +
691                        "    float V = c.z;\n" +
692                        "    if (L <= 0.0001) {\n" +
693                        "        return vec3(0.0);\n" +
694                        "    } else if(L >= 0.9999) {\n" +
695                        "        return vec3(1.0);\n" +
696                        "    } else {\n" +
697                        "        c.y = (L + 0.16) / 1.16;\n" +
698                        "        float prop = c.y * c.y * c.y;\n" +
699                        "        if(prop > epsilon.x) c.y = prop;\n" +
700                        "        else c.y = (1.16 * c.y - 0.16) / kappa;\n" +
701                        "    }\n" +
702                        "    float iL = 1. / (13.0 * L);\n" +
703                        "    float varU = U * iL + refUV.x;\n" +
704                        "    float varV = V * iL + refUV.y;\n" +
705                        "    c.x = -9. * c.y * varU / (-4. * varV);\n" +
706                        "    c.z = (9 * c.y - 15 * varV * c.y - varV * c.x) / (3 * varV);\n" +
707                        "    vec3 rgb = c * m;\n" +
708                        "    return rgb;\n" +
709                        "}\n" +
710

718//                        "    if(len > lim) {\n" +
719//                        "      lim /= len;\n" +
720//                        "      U *= lim;\n" +
721//                        "      V *= lim;\n" +
722//                        "    }\n" +
723//                        "    if (L <= 0.0001) {\n" +
724//                        "        return vec3(0.0);\n" +
725//                        "    } else if(L >= 0.9999) {\n" +
726//                        "        return vec3(1.0);\n" +
727//                        "    } else {\n" +

731//                        "        c.y = (L + 0.16) / 1.16;\n" +

740//                        "    vec3 rgb = c * m;\n" +
741//                        "    return rgb;\n" +
742//                        "}\n" +
743                        "void main()\n" +
744                        "{\n" +

747                        "  luv.x = forwardLight(clamp(pow(luv.x, v_tweak.w) * v_lightFix * v_tweak.z + v_color.x - 0.5372549, 0.0, 1.0));\n" +
748                        "  luv.yz = (luv.yz * v_tweak.y * 2.0) + (v_color.yz);\n" +
749                        "  gl_FragColor = vec4(sRGB(clamp(luv2rgb(luv), 0.0, 1.0)), v_color.a * tgt.a);\n" +
750                        "}";
751        ShaderProgram shader = new ShaderProgram(vertexShader, fragmentShader);
752        if (!shader.isCompiled()) throw new IllegalArgumentException("Error compiling shader: " + shader.getLog());
753        return shader;

755*/
756    @Override
757    public void begin () {
758        if (drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.end must be called before begin.");
759        renderCalls = 0;
760
761        Gdx.gl.glDepthMask(false);
762        if (customShader != null)
763            customShader.bind();
764        else
765            shader.bind();
766        setupMatrices();
767
768        drawing = true;
769    }
770
771    @Override
772    public void end () {
773        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before end.");
774        if (idx > 0) flush();
775        lastTexture = null;
776        drawing = false;
777
778        GL20 gl = Gdx.gl;
779        gl.glDepthMask(true);
780        if (isBlendingEnabled()) gl.glDisable(GL20.GL_BLEND);
781    }
782
783    @Override
784    public void setColor (Color tint) {
785        color = tint.toFloatBits();
786    }
787
788    /**
789     * Sets the color to the result of {@link ColorTools#clamp(float, float, float, float)} on the same arguments.
790     * For the H/S/L parameters, 0.5f is a neutral value (causing no change), while for alpha, 1.0f is a neutral
791     * value. For H/S/L, higher values will add to the corresponding channel, while lower values will subtract from it.
792     * @see ColorTools#clamp(float, float, float, float)
793     * @param H hue; additive; from 0 to 1, with red at 0, orange above red, yellow above orange, etc.
794     * @param S saturation; additive; from 0 to 1, with 0 desaturating and 1 very saturating
795     * @param L lightness; additive; ranges from 0 (closer to black) to 1 (closer to white)
796     * @param alpha opacity, from 0 to 1; multiplicative
797     */
798    @Override
799    public void setColor (float H, float S, float L, float alpha) {
800        color = ColorTools.clamp(H, S, L, alpha);
801    }
802
803    public void setColor (final float color) {
804        setPackedColor(color);
805    }
806
807    /**
808     * Expects an int color in the format (hue, 8 bits), (saturation, 8 bits), (lightness, 8 bits), (alpha, 7 bits),
809     * (ignored, 1 bit).
810     * @param color an int color with alpha in the least significant byte and hue in the most significant
811     */
812    public void setIntColor(final int color) {
813        this.color = NumberUtils.intBitsToFloat(Integer.reverseBytes(color & -2));
814    }
815
816    /**
817     * Sets the color with the given H/S/L and S parameters from 0 to 255.
818     * For the H/S/L parameters, 127 or 128 is a neutral value (causing no change), while for alpha, 255 is a neutral
819     * value. For H/S/L, higher values will add to the corresponding channel, while lower values will subtract from it.
820     * @see ColorTools#hsluv(float, float, float, float)
821     * @param H hue; additive; from 0 to 255, with red at 0, orange above red, yellow above orange, etc.
822     * @param S saturation; additive; from 0 to 255, with 0 desaturating and 255 very saturating
823     * @param L lightness; additive; ranges from 0 (closer to black) to 255 (closer to white)
824     * @param alpha opacity, from 0 to 255 (254 is equivalent, since the lowest bit is discarded); multiplicative
825     */
826    public void setIntColor(int H, int S, int L, int alpha) {
827        color = NumberUtils.intBitsToFloat((alpha << 24 & 0xFE000000)
828                | (L << 16 & 0xFF0000) | (S << 8 & 0xFF00) | (H & 0xFF));
829    }
830
831    @Override
832    public void setPackedColor (final float color) {
833        this.color = color;
834    }
835
836    @Override
837    public Color getColor () {
838        final int intBits = NumberUtils.floatToRawIntBits(color);
839        Color color = tempColor;
840        color.r = (intBits & 0xff) / 255f;
841        color.g = ((intBits >>> 8) & 0xff) / 255f;
842        color.b = ((intBits >>> 16) & 0xff) / 255f;
843        color.a = (intBits >>> 25) / 127f;
844        return color;
845    }
846
847    @Override
848    public float getPackedColor () {
849        return color;
850    }
851
852    /**
853     * Sets the multiplicative and contrast parts of the shader's color changes. 0.5 is a neutral value that should have
854     * minimal effect on the image; using {@code (0.5f, 0.5f, 0.5f, 0.5f)} will effectively remove the tweak.
855     * @param H hue; multiplicative; probably doesn't work very well and should just be 0.5f
856     * @param S saturation; multiplicative; from 0 to 1, with 0 forcing grayscale and 1 emphasizing saturation
857     * @param L lightness; multiplicative; ranges from 0 (sets lightness to 0) to 1 (doubles lightness)
858     * @param contrast affects how lightness changes; ranges from 0 (low contrast, cloudy look) to 1 (high contrast, sharpened look) 
859     */
860    public void setTweak (float H, float S, float L, float contrast) {
861        tweak = ColorTools.clamp(H, S, L, contrast);
862    }
863    /**
864     * Sets the tweak using a single packed CIELAB float.
865     * @see #setTweak(float, float, float, float)
866     * @param tweak a packed CIELAB float, with contrast instead of alpha
867     */
868    public void setTweak (final float tweak) {
869        this.tweak = tweak;
870    }
871    
872    public float getTweak () {
873        return tweak;
874    }
875
876    /**
877     * Takes the tweak as an int in the format: H (8 bits), S (8 bits), L (8 bits), contrast (7 bits),
878     * (1 ignored bit at the end). An example would be 0x8020A06E, which doesn't change hue (using the default 0x80),
879     * significantly reduces colorfulness with S multiplier 0x20 (closer to 0, so most colors will be almost grayscale),
880     * raises lightness somewhat with L multiplier 0xA0 (above the neutral point of 0x80), and slightly reduces contrast
881     * (with contrast and the ignored bit as 0x6E, which is less than the halfway point).
882     * @param tweak the tweak to use as an integer, with L in the most significant bits and contrast in least
883     */
884    public void setIntTweak(final int tweak) {
885        this.tweak = NumberUtils.intBitsToFloat(Integer.reverseBytes(tweak & -2));
886    }
887
888    /**
889     * Sets the multiplicative and contrast parts of the shader's color changes. 128 is a neutral value that should have
890     * minimal effect on the image; using {@code (128, 128, 128, 128)} will effectively remove the tweak.
891     * @param H hue; multiplicative; probably doesn't work very well and should just be 128
892     * @param S saturation; multiplicative; from 0 to 255, with 0 forcing grayscale and 255 emphasizing saturation
893     * @param L lightness; multiplicative; ranges from 0 (sets lightness to 0) to 255 (doubles lightness)
894     * @param contrast affects how lightness changes; ranges from 0 (low contrast, cloudy look) to 255 (high contrast, sharpened look) 
895     */
896    public void setIntTweak(int H, int S, int L, int contrast) {
897        tweak = NumberUtils.intBitsToFloat((contrast << 24 & 0xFE000000)
898                | (L << 16 & 0xFF0000) | (S << 8 & 0xFF00) | (H & 0xFF));
899    }
900
901    /**
902     * A convenience method that sets both the color (with {@link #setColor(float)}) and the tweak (with
903     * {@link #setTweak(float)}) at the same time, using two packed floats.
904     * @param color the additive components and alpha, as a packed float
905     * @param tweak the multiplicative components and contrast, as a packed float
906     */
907    public void setTweakedColor(final float color, final float tweak) {
908        setColor(color);
909        setTweak(tweak);
910    }
911
912    /**
913     * A convenience method that sets both the color (with {@link #setColor(float, float, float, float)}) and the tweak
914     * (with {@link #setTweak(float, float, float, float)}) at the same time.
915     * @param addH hue; additive; from 0 to 1, with red at 0, orange above red, yellow above orange, etc.
916     * @param addS saturation; additive; from 0 to 1, with 0 desaturating and 1 very saturating
917     * @param addL lightness; additive; ranges from 0 (closer to black) to 1 (closer to white)
918     * @param mulAlpha opacity, from 0 to 1; multiplicative
919     * @param mulH hue; multiplicative; probably doesn't work very well and should just be 0.5f
920     * @param mulS saturation; multiplicative; from 0 to 1, with 0 forcing grayscale and 1 emphasizing saturation
921     * @param mulL lightness; multiplicative; ranges from 0 (sets lightness to 0) to 1 (doubles lightness)
922     * @param contrast foggy-to-sharp lightness contrast; affects most other components; ranges from 0 (flat, foggy lightness) to 1 (sharp, crisp lightness)
923     */
924    public void setTweakedColor(final float addH, final float addS,
925                                final float addL, final float mulAlpha,
926                                final float mulH, final float mulS,
927                                final float mulL, final float contrast) {
928        setColor(addH, addS, addL, mulAlpha);
929        setTweak(mulH, mulS, mulL, contrast);
930    }
931
932    @Override
933    public void draw (Texture texture, float x, float y, float originX, float originY, float width, float height, float scaleX,
934                      float scaleY, float rotation, int srcX, int srcY, int srcWidth, int srcHeight, boolean flipX, boolean flipY) {
935        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
936
937        float[] vertices = this.vertices;
938
939        if (texture != lastTexture)
940            switchTexture(texture);
941        else if (idx == vertices.length) //
942            flush();
943
944        // bottom left and top right corner points relative to origin
945        final float worldOriginX = x + originX;
946        final float worldOriginY = y + originY;
947        float fx = -originX;
948        float fy = -originY;
949        float fx2 = width - originX;
950        float fy2 = height - originY;
951
952        // scale
953        if (scaleX != 1 || scaleY != 1) {
954            fx *= scaleX;
955            fy *= scaleY;
956            fx2 *= scaleX;
957            fy2 *= scaleY;
958        }
959
960        // construct corner points, start from top left and go counter clockwise
961        final float p1x = fx;
962        final float p1y = fy;
963        final float p2x = fx;
964        final float p2y = fy2;
965        final float p3x = fx2;
966        final float p3y = fy2;
967        final float p4x = fx2;
968        final float p4y = fy;
969
970        float x1;
971        float y1;
972        float x2;
973        float y2;
974        float x3;
975        float y3;
976        float x4;
977        float y4;
978
979        // rotate
980        if (rotation != 0) {
981            final float cos = MathUtils.cosDeg(rotation);
982            final float sin = MathUtils.sinDeg(rotation);
983
984            x1 = cos * p1x - sin * p1y;
985            y1 = sin * p1x + cos * p1y;
986
987            x2 = cos * p2x - sin * p2y;
988            y2 = sin * p2x + cos * p2y;
989
990            x3 = cos * p3x - sin * p3y;
991            y3 = sin * p3x + cos * p3y;
992
993            x4 = x1 + (x3 - x2);
994            y4 = y3 - (y2 - y1);
995        } else {
996            x1 = p1x;
997            y1 = p1y;
998
999            x2 = p2x;
1000            y2 = p2y;
1001
1002            x3 = p3x;
1003            y3 = p3y;
1004
1005            x4 = p4x;
1006            y4 = p4y;
1007        }
1008
1009        x1 += worldOriginX;
1010        y1 += worldOriginY;
1011        x2 += worldOriginX;
1012        y2 += worldOriginY;
1013        x3 += worldOriginX;
1014        y3 += worldOriginY;
1015        x4 += worldOriginX;
1016        y4 += worldOriginY;
1017
1018        float u = srcX * invTexWidth;
1019        float v = (srcY + srcHeight) * invTexHeight;
1020        float u2 = (srcX + srcWidth) * invTexWidth;
1021        float v2 = srcY * invTexHeight;
1022
1023        if (flipX) {
1024            float tmp = u;
1025            u = u2;
1026            u2 = tmp;
1027        }
1028
1029        if (flipY) {
1030            float tmp = v;
1031            v = v2;
1032            v2 = tmp;
1033        }
1034
1035        final float color = this.color;
1036        final float tweak = this.tweak;
1037        final int idx = this.idx;
1038        vertices[idx] = x1;
1039        vertices[idx + 1] = y1;
1040        vertices[idx + 2] = color;
1041        vertices[idx + 3] = u;
1042        vertices[idx + 4] = v;
1043        vertices[idx + 5] = tweak;
1044
1045        vertices[idx + 6] = x2;
1046        vertices[idx + 7] = y2;
1047        vertices[idx + 8] = color;
1048        vertices[idx + 9] = u;
1049        vertices[idx + 10] = v2;
1050        vertices[idx + 11] = tweak;
1051
1052        vertices[idx + 12] = x3;
1053        vertices[idx + 13] = y3;
1054        vertices[idx + 14] = color;
1055        vertices[idx + 15] = u2;
1056        vertices[idx + 16] = v2;
1057        vertices[idx + 17] = tweak;
1058
1059        vertices[idx + 18] = x4;
1060        vertices[idx + 19] = y4;
1061        vertices[idx + 20] = color;
1062        vertices[idx + 21] = u2;
1063        vertices[idx + 22] = v;
1064        vertices[idx + 23] = tweak;
1065        this.idx = idx + 24;
1066    }
1067
1068    @Override
1069    public void draw (Texture texture, float x, float y, float width, float height, int srcX, int srcY, int srcWidth,
1070                      int srcHeight, boolean flipX, boolean flipY) {
1071        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
1072
1073        float[] vertices = this.vertices;
1074
1075        if (texture != lastTexture)
1076            switchTexture(texture);
1077        else if (idx == vertices.length) //
1078            flush();
1079
1080        float u = srcX * invTexWidth;
1081        float v = (srcY + srcHeight) * invTexHeight;
1082        float u2 = (srcX + srcWidth) * invTexWidth;
1083        float v2 = srcY * invTexHeight;
1084        final float fx2 = x + width;
1085        final float fy2 = y + height;
1086
1087        if (flipX) {
1088            float tmp = u;
1089            u = u2;
1090            u2 = tmp;
1091        }
1092
1093        if (flipY) {
1094            float tmp = v;
1095            v = v2;
1096            v2 = tmp;
1097        }
1098
1099        final float color = this.color;
1100        final float tweak = this.tweak;
1101        final int idx = this.idx;
1102        vertices[idx] = x;
1103        vertices[idx + 1] = y;
1104        vertices[idx + 2] = color;
1105        vertices[idx + 3] = u;
1106        vertices[idx + 4] = v;
1107        vertices[idx + 5] = tweak;
1108
1109        vertices[idx + 6] = x;
1110        vertices[idx + 7] = fy2;
1111        vertices[idx + 8] = color;
1112        vertices[idx + 9] = u;
1113        vertices[idx + 10] = v2;
1114        vertices[idx + 11] = tweak;
1115
1116        vertices[idx + 12] = fx2;
1117        vertices[idx + 13] = fy2;
1118        vertices[idx + 14] = color;
1119        vertices[idx + 15] = u2;
1120        vertices[idx + 16] = v2;
1121        vertices[idx + 17] = tweak;
1122
1123        vertices[idx + 18] = fx2;
1124        vertices[idx + 19] = y;
1125        vertices[idx + 20] = color;
1126        vertices[idx + 21] = u2;
1127        vertices[idx + 22] = v;
1128        vertices[idx + 23] = tweak;
1129        this.idx = idx + 24;
1130    }

1235    @Override
1236    public void draw (Texture texture, float x, float y, float width, float height) {
1237        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
1238
1239        float[] vertices = this.vertices;
1240
1241        if (texture != lastTexture)
1242            switchTexture(texture);
1243        else if (idx == vertices.length) //
1244            flush();
1245
1246        final float fx2 = x + width;
1247        final float fy2 = y + height;
1248        final float u = 0;
1249        final float v = 1;
1250        final float u2 = 1;
1251        final float v2 = 0;
1252
1253        final float color = this.color;
1254        final float tweak = this.tweak;
1255        final int idx = this.idx;
1256        vertices[idx] = x;
1257        vertices[idx + 1] = y;
1258        vertices[idx + 2] = color;
1259        vertices[idx + 3] = u;
1260        vertices[idx + 4] = v;
1261        vertices[idx + 5] = tweak;
1262
1263        vertices[idx + 6] = x;
1264        vertices[idx + 7] = fy2;
1265        vertices[idx + 8] = color;
1266        vertices[idx + 9] = u;
1267        vertices[idx + 10] = v2;
1268        vertices[idx + 11] = tweak;
1269
1270        vertices[idx + 12] = fx2;
1271        vertices[idx + 13] = fy2;
1272        vertices[idx + 14] = color;
1273        vertices[idx + 15] = u2;
1274        vertices[idx + 16] = v2;
1275        vertices[idx + 17] = tweak;
1276
1277        vertices[idx + 18] = fx2;
1278        vertices[idx + 19] = y;
1279        vertices[idx + 20] = color;
1280        vertices[idx + 21] = u2;
1281        vertices[idx + 22] = v;
1282        vertices[idx + 23] = tweak;
1283        this.idx = idx + 24;
1284    }
1285
1286    /**
1287     * This is very different from the other overloads in this class; it assumes the float array it is given is in the
1288     * format libGDX uses to give to SpriteBatch, that is, in groups of 20 floats per sprite. ColorfulBatch uses 24
1289     * floats per sprite, to add tweak per color, so this does some conversion.
1290     * @param texture the Texture being drawn from; usually an atlas or some parent Texture with lots of TextureRegions
1291     * @param spriteVertices not the same format as {@link #vertices} in this class; should have a length that's a multiple of 20
1292     * @param offset where to start drawing vertices from {@code spriteVertices}
1293     * @param count how many vertices to draw from {@code spriteVertices} (20 vertices is one sprite)
1294     */
1295    @Override
1296    public void draw (Texture texture, float[] spriteVertices, int offset, int count) {
1297        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
1298
1299        count = (count / 5) * 6;
1300        int verticesLength = vertices.length;
1301        int remainingVertices = verticesLength;
1302        if (texture != lastTexture)
1303            switchTexture(texture);
1304        else {
1305            remainingVertices -= idx;
1306            if (remainingVertices == 0) {
1307                flush();
1308                remainingVertices = verticesLength;
1309            }
1310        }
1311        int copyCount = Math.min(remainingVertices, count);
1312        final float tweak = this.tweak;
1313
1314        ////old way, breaks when libGDX code expects SPRITE_SIZE to be 20
1315        //System.arraycopy(spriteVertices, offset, vertices, idx, copyCount);
1316        ////new way, thanks mgsx
1317        for (int s = offset, v = idx, i = 0; i < copyCount; i += 6) {
1318            vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
1319            vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
1320            vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
1321            vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
1322            vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
1323            vertices[v++] = tweak;
1324        }
1325        idx += copyCount;
1326        count -= copyCount;
1327        while (count > 0) {
1328            offset += (copyCount / 6) * 5;
1329            flush();
1330            copyCount = Math.min(verticesLength, count);
1331            ////old way, breaks when libGDX code expects SPRITE_SIZE to be 20
1332            //System.arraycopy(spriteVertices, offset, vertices, 0, copyCount);
1333            ////new way, thanks mgsx
1334            for (int s = offset, v = 0, i = 0; i < copyCount; i += 6) {
1335                vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
1336                vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
1337                vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
1338                vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
1339                vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
1340                vertices[v++] = tweak;
1341            }
1342            idx += copyCount;
1343            count -= copyCount;
1344        }
1345    }
1346
1347    /**
1348     * Meant for code that uses ColorfulBatch specifically and can set an extra float (for the color tweak) per vertex,
1349     * this is just like {@link #draw(Texture, float[], int, int)} when used in other Batch implementations, but expects
1350     * {@code spriteVertices} to have a length that is a multiple of 24 instead of 20.
1351     * @param texture the Texture being drawn from; usually an atlas or some parent Texture with lots of TextureRegions
1352     * @param spriteVertices vertices formatted as this class uses them; length should be a multiple of 24
1353     * @param offset where to start drawing vertices from {@code spriteVertices}
1354     * @param count how many vertices to draw from {@code spriteVertices} (24 vertices is one sprite)
1355     */
1356    public void drawExactly (Texture texture, float[] spriteVertices, int offset, int count) {
1357        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
1358
1359        int verticesLength = vertices.length;
1360        int remainingVertices = verticesLength;
1361        if (texture != lastTexture)
1362            switchTexture(texture);
1363        else {
1364            remainingVertices -= idx;
1365            if (remainingVertices == 0) {
1366                flush();
1367                remainingVertices = verticesLength;
1368            }
1369        }
1370        int copyCount = Math.min(remainingVertices, count);
1371
1372        System.arraycopy(spriteVertices, offset, vertices, idx, copyCount);
1373        idx += copyCount;
1374        count -= copyCount;
1375        while (count > 0) {
1376            offset += copyCount;
1377            flush();
1378            copyCount = Math.min(verticesLength, count);
1379            System.arraycopy(spriteVertices, offset, vertices, 0, copyCount);
1380            idx += copyCount;
1381            count -= copyCount;
1382        }
1383    }
1384
1385    @Override
1386    public void draw (TextureRegion region, float x, float y) {
1387        draw(region, x, y, region.getRegionWidth(), region.getRegionHeight());
1388    }
1389
1390    @Override
1391    public void draw (TextureRegion region, float x, float y, float width, float height) {
1392        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
1393
1394        float[] vertices = this.vertices;
1395
1396        Texture texture = region.getTexture();
1397        if (texture != lastTexture) {
1398            switchTexture(texture);
1399        } else if (idx == vertices.length) {
1400            flush();
1401        }
1402        final float fx2 = x + width;
1403        final float fy2 = y + height;
1404        final float u = region.getU();
1405        final float v = region.getV2();
1406        final float u2 = region.getU2();
1407        final float v2 = region.getV();
1408
1409        final float color = this.color;
1410        final float tweak = this.tweak;
1411        final int idx = this.idx;
1412        vertices[idx] = x;
1413        vertices[idx + 1] = y;
1414        vertices[idx + 2] = color;
1415        vertices[idx + 3] = u;
1416        vertices[idx + 4] = v;
1417        vertices[idx + 5] = tweak;
1418
1419        vertices[idx + 6] = x;
1420        vertices[idx + 7] = fy2;
1421        vertices[idx + 8] = color;
1422        vertices[idx + 9] = u;
1423        vertices[idx + 10] = v2;
1424        vertices[idx + 11] = tweak;
1425
1426        vertices[idx + 12] = fx2;
1427        vertices[idx + 13] = fy2;
1428        vertices[idx + 14] = color;
1429        vertices[idx + 15] = u2;
1430        vertices[idx + 16] = v2;
1431        vertices[idx + 17] = tweak;
1432
1433        vertices[idx + 18] = fx2;
1434        vertices[idx + 19] = y;
1435        vertices[idx + 20] = color;
1436        vertices[idx + 21] = u2;
1437        vertices[idx + 22] = v;
1438        vertices[idx + 23] = tweak;
1439        this.idx = idx + 24;
1440    }
1441
1442    @Override
1443    public void draw (TextureRegion region, float x, float y, float originX, float originY, float width, float height,
1444                      float scaleX, float scaleY, float rotation) {
1445        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
1446
1447        float[] vertices = this.vertices;
1448
1449        Texture texture = region.getTexture();
1450        if (texture != lastTexture) {
1451            switchTexture(texture);
1452        } else if (idx == vertices.length) //
1453            flush();
1454
1455        // bottom left and top right corner points relative to origin
1456        final float worldOriginX = x + originX;
1457        final float worldOriginY = y + originY;
1458        float fx = -originX;
1459        float fy = -originY;
1460        float fx2 = width - originX;
1461        float fy2 = height - originY;
1462
1463        // scale
1464        if (scaleX != 1 || scaleY != 1) {
1465            fx *= scaleX;
1466            fy *= scaleY;
1467            fx2 *= scaleX;
1468            fy2 *= scaleY;
1469        }
1470
1471        // construct corner points, start from top left and go counter clockwise
1472        final float p1x = fx;
1473        final float p1y = fy;
1474        final float p2x = fx;
1475        final float p2y = fy2;
1476        final float p3x = fx2;
1477        final float p3y = fy2;
1478        final float p4x = fx2;
1479        final float p4y = fy;
1480
1481        float x1;
1482        float y1;
1483        float x2;
1484        float y2;
1485        float x3;
1486        float y3;
1487        float x4;
1488        float y4;
1489
1490        // rotate
1491        if (rotation != 0) {
1492            final float cos = MathUtils.cosDeg(rotation);
1493            final float sin = MathUtils.sinDeg(rotation);
1494
1495            x1 = cos * p1x - sin * p1y;
1496            y1 = sin * p1x + cos * p1y;
1497
1498            x2 = cos * p2x - sin * p2y;
1499            y2 = sin * p2x + cos * p2y;
1500
1501            x3 = cos * p3x - sin * p3y;
1502            y3 = sin * p3x + cos * p3y;
1503
1504            x4 = x1 + (x3 - x2);
1505            y4 = y3 - (y2 - y1);
1506        } else {
1507            x1 = p1x;
1508            y1 = p1y;
1509
1510            x2 = p2x;
1511            y2 = p2y;
1512
1513            x3 = p3x;
1514            y3 = p3y;
1515
1516            x4 = p4x;
1517            y4 = p4y;
1518        }
1519
1520        x1 += worldOriginX;
1521        y1 += worldOriginY;
1522        x2 += worldOriginX;
1523        y2 += worldOriginY;
1524        x3 += worldOriginX;
1525        y3 += worldOriginY;
1526        x4 += worldOriginX;
1527        y4 += worldOriginY;
1528
1529        final float u = region.getU();
1530        final float v = region.getV2();
1531        final float u2 = region.getU2();
1532        final float v2 = region.getV();
1533
1534        final float color = this.color;
1535        final float tweak = this.tweak;
1536        final int idx = this.idx;
1537        vertices[idx] = x1;
1538        vertices[idx + 1] = y1;
1539        vertices[idx + 2] = color;
1540        vertices[idx + 3] = u;
1541        vertices[idx + 4] = v;
1542        vertices[idx + 5] = tweak;
1543
1544        vertices[idx + 6] = x2;
1545        vertices[idx + 7] = y2;
1546        vertices[idx + 8] = color;
1547        vertices[idx + 9] = u;
1548        vertices[idx + 10] = v2;
1549        vertices[idx + 11] = tweak;
1550
1551        vertices[idx + 12] = x3;
1552        vertices[idx + 13] = y3;
1553        vertices[idx + 14] = color;
1554        vertices[idx + 15] = u2;
1555        vertices[idx + 16] = v2;
1556        vertices[idx + 17] = tweak;
1557
1558        vertices[idx + 18] = x4;
1559        vertices[idx + 19] = y4;
1560        vertices[idx + 20] = color;
1561        vertices[idx + 21] = u2;
1562        vertices[idx + 22] = v;
1563        vertices[idx + 23] = tweak;
1564        this.idx = idx + 24;
1565    }
1566
1567    @Override
1568    public void draw (TextureRegion region, float x, float y, float originX, float originY, float width, float height,
1569                      float scaleX, float scaleY, float rotation, boolean clockwise) {
1570        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
1571
1572        float[] vertices = this.vertices;
1573
1574        Texture texture = region.getTexture();
1575        if (texture != lastTexture) {
1576            switchTexture(texture);
1577        } else if (idx == vertices.length) //
1578            flush();
1579
1580        // bottom left and top right corner points relative to origin
1581        final float worldOriginX = x + originX;
1582        final float worldOriginY = y + originY;
1583        float fx = -originX;
1584        float fy = -originY;
1585        float fx2 = width - originX;
1586        float fy2 = height - originY;
1587
1588        // scale
1589        if (scaleX != 1 || scaleY != 1) {
1590            fx *= scaleX;
1591            fy *= scaleY;
1592            fx2 *= scaleX;
1593            fy2 *= scaleY;
1594        }
1595
1596        // construct corner points, start from top left and go counter clockwise
1597        final float p1x = fx;
1598        final float p1y = fy;
1599        final float p2x = fx;
1600        final float p2y = fy2;
1601        final float p3x = fx2;
1602        final float p3y = fy2;
1603        final float p4x = fx2;
1604        final float p4y = fy;
1605
1606        float x1;
1607        float y1;
1608        float x2;
1609        float y2;
1610        float x3;
1611        float y3;
1612        float x4;
1613        float y4;
1614
1615        // rotate
1616        if (rotation != 0) {
1617            final float cos = MathUtils.cosDeg(rotation);
1618            final float sin = MathUtils.sinDeg(rotation);
1619
1620            x1 = cos * p1x - sin * p1y;
1621            y1 = sin * p1x + cos * p1y;
1622
1623            x2 = cos * p2x - sin * p2y;
1624            y2 = sin * p2x + cos * p2y;
1625
1626            x3 = cos * p3x - sin * p3y;
1627            y3 = sin * p3x + cos * p3y;
1628
1629            x4 = x1 + (x3 - x2);
1630            y4 = y3 - (y2 - y1);
1631        } else {
1632            x1 = p1x;
1633            y1 = p1y;
1634
1635            x2 = p2x;
1636            y2 = p2y;
1637
1638            x3 = p3x;
1639            y3 = p3y;
1640
1641            x4 = p4x;
1642            y4 = p4y;
1643        }
1644
1645        x1 += worldOriginX;
1646        y1 += worldOriginY;
1647        x2 += worldOriginX;
1648        y2 += worldOriginY;
1649        x3 += worldOriginX;
1650        y3 += worldOriginY;
1651        x4 += worldOriginX;
1652        y4 += worldOriginY;
1653
1654        float u1, v1, u2, v2, u3, v3, u4, v4;
1655        if (clockwise) {
1656            u1 = region.getU2();
1657            v1 = region.getV2();
1658            u2 = region.getU();
1659            v2 = region.getV2();
1660            u3 = region.getU();
1661            v3 = region.getV();
1662            u4 = region.getU2();
1663            v4 = region.getV();
1664        } else {
1665            u1 = region.getU();
1666            v1 = region.getV();
1667            u2 = region.getU2();
1668            v2 = region.getV();
1669            u3 = region.getU2();
1670            v3 = region.getV2();
1671            u4 = region.getU();
1672            v4 = region.getV2();
1673        }
1674
1675        final float color = this.color;
1676        final float tweak = this.tweak;
1677        final int idx = this.idx;
1678        vertices[idx] = x1;
1679        vertices[idx + 1] = y1;
1680        vertices[idx + 2] = color;
1681        vertices[idx + 3] = u1;
1682        vertices[idx + 4] = v1;
1683        vertices[idx + 5] = tweak;
1684
1685        vertices[idx + 6] = x2;
1686        vertices[idx + 7] = y2;
1687        vertices[idx + 8] = color;
1688        vertices[idx + 9] = u2;
1689        vertices[idx + 10] = v2;
1690        vertices[idx + 11] = tweak;
1691
1692        vertices[idx + 12] = x3;
1693        vertices[idx + 13] = y3;
1694        vertices[idx + 14] = color;
1695        vertices[idx + 15] = u3;
1696        vertices[idx + 16] = v3;
1697        vertices[idx + 17] = tweak;
1698
1699        vertices[idx + 18] = x4;
1700        vertices[idx + 19] = y4;
1701        vertices[idx + 20] = color;
1702        vertices[idx + 21] = u4;
1703        vertices[idx + 22] = v4;
1704        vertices[idx + 23] = tweak;
1705        this.idx = idx + 24;
1706    }
1707
1708    @Override
1709    public void draw (TextureRegion region, float width, float height, Affine2 transform) {
1710        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
1711
1712        float[] vertices = this.vertices;
1713
1714        Texture texture = region.getTexture();
1715        if (texture != lastTexture) {
1716            switchTexture(texture);
1717        } else if (idx == vertices.length) {
1718            flush();
1719        }
1720
1721        // construct corner points
1722        float x1 = transform.m02;
1723        float y1 = transform.m12;
1724        float x2 = transform.m01 * height + transform.m02;
1725        float y2 = transform.m11 * height + transform.m12;
1726        float x3 = transform.m00 * width + transform.m01 * height + transform.m02;
1727        float y3 = transform.m10 * width + transform.m11 * height + transform.m12;
1728        float x4 = transform.m00 * width + transform.m02;
1729        float y4 = transform.m10 * width + transform.m12;
1730
1731        float u = region.getU();
1732        float v = region.getV2();
1733        float u2 = region.getU2();
1734        float v2 = region.getV();
1735
1736        final float color = this.color;
1737        final float tweak = this.tweak;
1738        final int idx = this.idx;
1739        vertices[idx] = x1;
1740        vertices[idx + 1] = y1;
1741        vertices[idx + 2] = color;
1742        vertices[idx + 3] = u;
1743        vertices[idx + 4] = v;
1744        vertices[idx + 5] = tweak;
1745
1746        vertices[idx + 6] = x2;
1747        vertices[idx + 7] = y2;
1748        vertices[idx + 8] = color;
1749        vertices[idx + 9] = u;
1750        vertices[idx + 10] = v2;
1751        vertices[idx + 11] = tweak;
1752
1753        vertices[idx + 12] = x3;
1754        vertices[idx + 13] = y3;
1755        vertices[idx + 14] = color;
1756        vertices[idx + 15] = u2;
1757        vertices[idx + 16] = v2;
1758        vertices[idx + 17] = tweak;
1759
1760        vertices[idx + 18] = x4;
1761        vertices[idx + 19] = y4;
1762        vertices[idx + 20] = color;
1763        vertices[idx + 21] = u2;
1764        vertices[idx + 22] = v;
1765        vertices[idx + 23] = tweak;
1766        this.idx = idx + 24;
1767    }
1768
1769    @SuppressWarnings("RedundantCast") // These casts are absolutely not redundant! Java 9 changed Buffer ABI.
1770    @Override
1771    public void flush () {
1772        if (idx == 0) return;
1773
1774        renderCalls++;
1775        totalRenderCalls++;
1776        int spritesInBatch = idx / SPRITE_SIZE;
1777        if (spritesInBatch > maxSpritesInBatch) maxSpritesInBatch = spritesInBatch;
1778        int count = spritesInBatch * 6;
1779
1780        lastTexture.bind();
1781        Mesh mesh = this.mesh;
1782        mesh.setVertices(vertices, 0, idx);
1783        ((Buffer)mesh.getIndicesBuffer()).position(0);
1784        ((Buffer)mesh.getIndicesBuffer()).limit(count);
1785
1786        if (blendingDisabled) {
1787            Gdx.gl.glDisable(GL20.GL_BLEND);
1788        } else {
1789            Gdx.gl.glEnable(GL20.GL_BLEND);
1790            if (blendSrcFunc != -1) Gdx.gl.glBlendFuncSeparate(blendSrcFunc, blendDstFunc, blendSrcFuncAlpha, blendDstFuncAlpha);
1791        }
1792
1793        mesh.render(customShader != null ? customShader : shader, GL20.GL_TRIANGLES, 0, count);
1794
1795        idx = 0;
1796    }
1797
1798    @Override
1799    public void disableBlending () {
1800        if (blendingDisabled) return;
1801        flush();
1802        blendingDisabled = true;
1803    }
1804
1805    @Override
1806    public void enableBlending () {
1807        if (!blendingDisabled) return;
1808        flush();
1809        blendingDisabled = false;
1810    }
1811
1812    @Override
1813    public void setBlendFunction (int srcFunc, int dstFunc) {
1814        setBlendFunctionSeparate(srcFunc, dstFunc, srcFunc, dstFunc);
1815    }
1816
1817    @Override
1818    public void setBlendFunctionSeparate(int srcFuncColor, int dstFuncColor, int srcFuncAlpha, int dstFuncAlpha) {
1819        if (blendSrcFunc == srcFuncColor && blendDstFunc == dstFuncColor && blendSrcFuncAlpha == srcFuncAlpha && blendDstFuncAlpha == dstFuncAlpha) return;
1820        flush();
1821        blendSrcFunc = srcFuncColor;
1822        blendDstFunc = dstFuncColor;
1823        blendSrcFuncAlpha = srcFuncAlpha;
1824        blendDstFuncAlpha = dstFuncAlpha;
1825    }
1826
1827    @Override
1828    public int getBlendSrcFunc () {
1829        return blendSrcFunc;
1830    }
1831
1832    @Override
1833    public int getBlendDstFunc () {
1834        return blendDstFunc;
1835    }
1836
1837    @Override
1838    public int getBlendSrcFuncAlpha() {
1839        return blendSrcFuncAlpha;
1840    }
1841
1842    @Override
1843    public int getBlendDstFuncAlpha() {
1844        return blendDstFuncAlpha;
1845    }
1846
1847    @Override
1848    public void dispose () {
1849        mesh.dispose();
1850        if (ownsShader && shader != null) shader.dispose();
1851    }
1852
1853    @Override
1854    public Matrix4 getProjectionMatrix () {
1855        return projectionMatrix;
1856    }
1857
1858    @Override
1859    public Matrix4 getTransformMatrix () {
1860        return transformMatrix;
1861    }
1862
1863    @Override
1864    public void setProjectionMatrix (Matrix4 projection) {
1865        if (drawing) flush();
1866        projectionMatrix.set(projection);
1867        if (drawing) setupMatrices();
1868    }
1869
1870    @Override
1871    public void setTransformMatrix (Matrix4 transform) {
1872        if (drawing) flush();
1873        transformMatrix.set(transform);
1874        if (drawing) setupMatrices();
1875    }
1876
1877    protected void setupMatrices () {
1878        combinedMatrix.set(projectionMatrix).mul(transformMatrix);
1879        if (customShader != null) {
1880            customShader.setUniformMatrix("u_projTrans", combinedMatrix);
1881            customShader.setUniformi("u_texture", 0);
1882        } else {
1883            shader.setUniformMatrix("u_projTrans", combinedMatrix);
1884            shader.setUniformi("u_texture", 0);
1885        }
1886    }
1887
1888    protected void switchTexture (Texture texture) {
1889        flush();
1890        lastTexture = texture;
1891        invTexWidth = 1.0f / texture.getWidth();
1892        invTexHeight = 1.0f / texture.getHeight();
1893    }
1894
1895    @Override
1896    public void setShader (ShaderProgram shader) {
1897        if (drawing) {
1898            flush();
1899        }
1900        customShader = shader;
1901        if (drawing) {
1902            if (customShader != null)
1903                customShader.bind();
1904            else
1905                this.shader.bind();
1906            setupMatrices();
1907        }
1908    }
1909
1910    @Override
1911    public ShaderProgram getShader () {
1912        if (customShader == null) {
1913            return shader;
1914        }
1915        return customShader;
1916    }
1917
1918    @Override
1919    public boolean isBlendingEnabled () {
1920        return !blendingDisabled;
1921    }
1922
1923    public boolean isDrawing () {
1924        return drawing;
1925    }

1930    public static final int V1 = 4;
1931    public static final int T1 = 5;
1932    public static final int X2 = 6;
1933    public static final int Y2 = 7;
1934    public static final int C2 = 8;
1935    public static final int U2 = 9;
1936    public static final int V2 = 10;
1937    public static final int T2 = 11;
1938    public static final int X3 = 12;
1939    public static final int Y3 = 13;
1940    public static final int C3 = 14;
1941    public static final int U3 = 15;
1942    public static final int V3 = 16;
1943    public static final int T3 = 17;
1944    public static final int X4 = 18;
1945    public static final int Y4 = 19;
1946    public static final int C4 = 20;
1947    public static final int U4 = 21;
1948    public static final int V4 = 22;
1949    public static final int T4 = 23;
